intro: Priestleya vestita, commonly known as the naked priestleya, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. Priestleya vestita typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually clustered in dense inflorescences.
